alert.note: Alert for Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Eastern Highland; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 23 at 8:53PM EST until December 24 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph, with visibility down to one mile where any blowing snow occurs. * WHERE...Extreme Western Allegany County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Blowing snow could also significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree and power line damage. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest wind speeds will be through this evening. Near blizzard conditions are possible. Affects from the extreme cold could be made worse due to power outages.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
